R for Researchers

Supercharge Your PhD with R!

R
Data Science
Summer School
Open
Thank you! For the Successful Completion of the 5‑Day Data Science Summer School, “R for Researchers”, held from 25–29 July 2025
Published

May 29, 2025


Unlock the Power of Data Science – No Prior Coding Experience Needed!
Registration Link

r-july-flyer by Sara Institute

International Guest Speakers

Wolf Riepl |

Trainer R-Programming

Statistik Dresden, Germany.

Betsabe Laila Cohen |

Sociologist | R Expert

RLadies Buenos Aires, Argentina.

Dr. Lito P Cruz |

Principal Data Science Consultant

Sleekersoft, Australia.

Anirban Shaw |

R & Py Data Science

Bristol Myers Squibb, India.

Dr. Cecilia Baldoni |

Biostatistician

Max Planck Institute, Germany.


Key Highlights

  • Hands-On Learning: Code, analyze, and visualize real-world datasets.
  • Expert Instructors: Learn from international data science expert professionals.
  • Fellowships for Marginalized Communities: 5 Scholarships available (priority to women, rural students, and SC/ST/OBC candidates).
  • Certificate of Completion: Boost your resume with a SARA-certified credential.
  • Networking: Connect with peers and mentors in the data science field.

Curriculum Snapshot

Day 1: R Basics – Syntax, Data Types, and Functions
Day 2: Data Wrangling with dplyr and tidyr
Day 3: Data Visualization using ggplot2
Day 4: Quantitative Data Analysis
Day 5: Reproducible Research in Quarto

See Section 1.5 for more information.

Who Should Join?

  • PhD Scholars & Students (UG/PG) in STEM, social sciences, or humanities.
  • Professionals seeking data-driven career growth.
  • Educators and researchers aiming to integrate R into their work.
  • Career changers exploring tech opportunities.

Program Details:

  • Dates: 25-29 July 2025
  • Duration: 5 days
  • Fee: ₹3,500 INR (Inclusive of food and accommodation), scholarships available for eligible candidates
  • Payment: You can secure your spot by making the payment via below QR or using our UPI ID is 919253152024@sbi.
  • Location: SARA Institute, Dr. Ambedkar Bhavan, Kakroi Road (near Dayanand Hospital), Sonipat, Haryana - 131001.

As a non-profit organization, SARA is committed to making education accessible to all. The fee covers only the essential costs of food and accommodation, ensuring that everyone has the opportunity to participate.



Course Details

5 Days Courses (9:30 AM to 1:00 PM & 2:00 PM to 5:30 PM; approx 30-35 hours):

25-29 July 2025 in Sonipat (HR), India


📅 DAY 1 (Fri 25 July): Introduction to Data Science

  • Online Expert Lecture
  • In-person sessions

Topic: Functional Programming in R and tidyverse

By Wolf Riepl Trainer R-Programming, Germany |

25 JULY 4 PM IST.

Faculty: Dr. Ajay Kumar Koli

  • R & RStudio.
  • Types of operators.
  • RStudio project.
  • Coding using console, script & quarto.
  • Structure of R function.
  • R packages.
  • Create objects.
  • Communicate using quarto.
  • Help from R community.


📅 DAY 2 (Sat 26 July): Data Wrangling with dplyr & tidyr

  • Online Expert Lecture
  • In-person sessions

Topic: Data Wrangling with the {tidyverse}

By Dr. Cecilia Baldoni Biostatistician, Germany

26 JULY 4 PM IST.

Faculty: Dr. Ajay Kumar Koli

  • Introduction to Tidyverse
  • Clean and transform messy datasets
  • Data Manipulation with dplyr
  • Reshaping Data with tidyr


📅 DAY 3 (Sun 27 July): Data Visualization using ggplot2

  • Online Expert Lecture
  • In-person sessions

Topic: Data Storytelling with R: From CSV to Interactive Visualization using Shiny

By Anirban Shaw R & Shiny Expert, India

27 JULY 4 PM IST.

Faculty: Dr. Ajay Kumar Koli

  • Introduction & first steps.
  • ggplot2 calls.
  • Visualizing distributions.
  • Visualizing relationships.
  • Saving your plots.
  • Common problems.


📅 DAY 4 (Mon 28 July): Quantitative Data Analysis

  • Online Expert Lecture
  • In-person sessions

Topic: Hypothesis Testing & Forecasting by Regression

By Dr. Lito P Cruz, Principal Data Science Consultant, Australia |

28 JULY 4 PM IST.

Faculty: Dr. Ajay Kumar Koli

  • Data and table manners.
  • Average & Spreads.
  • The normal distribution.
  • From samples to populations.
  • Hypothesis testing - getting confident.
  • Correlation and regression.


📅 DAY 5 (Tue 29 July): Reproducible Research using Quarto

  • Online Expert Lecture
  • In-person sessions

Topic - From Code to Paper: Reproducible Research with Quarto

By Betsabe Laila Cohen, Sociologist & R expert, Argentina |

29 JULY 4 PM IST.

Faculty: Dr. Ajay Kumar Koli

  • Reproducible research.
  • Dynamic thesis, articles and slides.
  • Add links and images.
  • Prepare list.
  • Write equations.
  • Prepare tables.
  • Reference management.


Refund Policy

1. Cancellation by Participant

  • 15+ Days Before Start Date:
    • 100% Refund: Full refund of fees paid.
  • 7–14 Days Before Start Date:
    • 50% Refund: Half of the fees paid.
  • Less Than 7 Days Before Start Date:
    • No Refund: Fees are non-refundable.

Process:

  • Submit a refund request via email to sara.institute.info@gmail.com with:
    • Participant name
    • Transaction details (payment ID, date).
    • Reason for cancellation.
  • Refunds processed within 7–10 business days via original payment method.

2. Scholarship Recipients

  • Scholarship seats are non-refundable.
  • If unable to attend, notify SARA at least 7 days prior to free the seat for another candidate.

3. Cancellation by SARA

  • If SARA cancels/reschedules the event:
    • 100% Refund: Full refund for all paid participants.
    • Option to Transfer: Join the next cohort at no extra cost.

4. Special Cases

  • Medical Emergencies: Submit a doctor’s certificate for refund consideration (partial/full, case-by-case basis).
  • Partial Attendance: No refunds for days attended.

5. Non-Refundable Components

  • Administrative Fees: ₹500 (deducted from all refunds).

Contact for Refunds

Email: sara.institute.info@gmail.com | 📞 Call: 925 315 2024

Note: SARA reserves the right to amend this policy. Exceptions apply only with prior written approval.


Proudly Supported by:

We’re happy to host you at Dr. Ambedkar Bhawan, on Kakroi Road, Sonipat, Haryana - 131001. Please find the venue’s Google Map link for your convenience: Venue Location.

At Dr. Ambedkar Bhawan, our priority is to ensure your comfort and well-being during your stay. While we may not offer hotel-like amenities, we are committed to providing you with a cozy and welcoming atmosphere.
